Appleseed builtins¶

These functions and macros are built in to the Appleseed interpreter. All of them, unlike library functions and macros, have type Builtin.

Arithmetic¶

add¶
  • First argument: Int or Bool
  • Second argument: Int or Bool
  • Returns: Int

Adds two numbers.

sub¶
  • First argument: Int or Bool
  • Second argument: Int or Bool
  • Returns: Int

Subtracts two numbers.

mul¶
  • First argument: Int or Bool
  • Second argument: Int or Bool
  • Returns: Int

Multiplies two numbers.

div¶
  • First argument: Int or Bool
  • Second argument: Int or Bool
  • Returns: Int
  • Errors if: second argument is 0 or false

Divides two numbers. Note that this is integer division, rounding down: (div 5 3) is 1; (div -5 3) is -2.

mod¶
  • First argument: Int or Bool
  • Second argument: Int or Bool
  • Returns: Int
  • Errors if: second argument is 0 or false

Returns its first argument modulo its second. Follows the same rules as Python regarding negative arguments: the return value is constrained to be between the second argument (exclusive) and zero (inclusive). As a result, (add (mul (div a b) b) (mod a b)) is always equal to a.

Lists¶

cons¶
  • First argument: any type
  • Second argument: List
  • Returns: List

Returns a new list with the first argument as the head and the second argument as the tail.

head¶
  • Argument: List
  • Returns: any type

Returns the head (first element) of the argument, or nil if the argument is an empty list.

tail¶
  • Argument: List
  • Returns: List

Returns a new list containing the tail (all but the first element) of the argument, or nil if the argument is an empty list.

Strings¶

str¶
chars¶
repr¶

Objects¶

object¶
has-property
get-property
copy¶

Booleans and conditionals¶

bool¶
